I am not looking for a boyfriend. I am looking for someone I am attracted to enough to see maybe once or twice a month for a date. I like well-educated, fit, alpha male Gordon Gekko types- I am very attracted to successful guys but I am not looking for money/ I will pay for my own drinks etc but that's just the type I go for.

I'm Ivy-educated, very fit, petite (5 ft, 105 lbs). Things I like: WORKING OUT. Lana Del Ray, Twin Peaks, Haruki Murakami, tennis, movies (esp. documentaries), air conditioning, dogs, summer.

Nothing said online takes the place of a real meet and greet. All the similar interests in the world don't make two people click in their personalities. What's important....honesty, a sense of humor, goofiness, loyalty, kindness, love of the outdoors and an appreciation for life. We all have flaws, especially at this point in life, embrace them or move on.

I only like little kids in very small doses, but I'd make a great aunt. I'm very good with them. I will wind them up, give them sugar and then happily give them back. I also know how to get my hands on the loudest toys known to man, but seriously, I don't want kids of my own. My animals are everything. They were here first and they are non negotiable. They are MY children. I would not want to force someone to like my dogs any more than I want someone to force me to like their kids. I am deathly allergic to cats and believe their only purpose is to kill mice in the barn. I'm super clean but have dogs. Get over the fact there will be dog hair on your clothes when you leave.

I LOVE trying new things, even the bad choices make me smile. We learn from our mistakes, right? Unless it involves food. I'm pretty much a spicy, comfort food, meat and potato kind of person. I workout, a LOT, to make up for it. Still tons of room for improvement in that category but I'm told I'm in good shape. What I do cook/bake will never come from a box and you will never find a TV dinner in my freezer. I'm drama and stress free and give anything in my life that causes either the boot. Probably why I'm still single. I don't like to be coddled but expect to be treated and appreciated as a strong woman should be. I'm fiercely loyal to those I care about and take care them as if it's their last day on earth.

I'm super independent. Don't take it personal if I disappear into the backcountry for three days alone. It's for my own sanity and probably everyone else's. I'll more than make up for it when I return. I do anything and everything outdoors and have a ton of "survival sense" and pretty sure my guardian angel drinks because of it. There is no such thing as bad weather, only bad clothing, but do prefer to be huddled up under a porch overhang than hiking when it's crappy out. I love to roam, explore and learn. I'm WAY more comfortable being rough and tumble than I am in a dress and heels, but do clean up nice for those special occasions.

If you couldn't tell, I'm straightforward and don't beat around the bush about anything. It takes a lot to rattle my chains or make me mad as long as things are said and done from the heart. Doesn't mean I won't be disappointed, I just won't pick a fight about it. I'm a very go with the flow kinda person. My jobs have more than served their purpose in showing me that a zest for life is important and being even just a little kind to someone has a huge trickle down effect. This is a bit long, I know, but I'm trying to weed out some of the weirdness this site attracts. Apparently, most men only like to look at the pictures.


Ok...I'm not sure if this is even going to work but I'm going to try. Are there any guys out there who is/are looking for an awesome, pretty, smart, funny 42 yr old single BBW that wants more than just sex?! Is that even possible to find on CL? As for what I'm looking for, I'm not really hung up on age younger/older is fine as long as you are mature. I don't want to play head games!! I want to be attracted to you but I also want a nice guy, who knows how to laugh at himself, that doesn't take life so serious and actually would like a relationship. Is that possible....??? title: Dear Special One !!
text:
If you only knew how often you cross my mind, consuming my thoughts. I miss you even though I've never had you. Throughout my life I have been lucky enough to experience love and I have also learnt what it feels like to go without. The dull ache from loneliness courses through my body. The tears have spilt out of my eyes landing on my pillow because sometimes it's too much to take. I know exactly how much I have to give to you. Craving so desperately your gentle embrace, just tight enough that I won't slip away but light enough to give me the room I need to breath. Wanting to drink you in and escape into you. I often sit alone at my table eating the food I've prepared looking at your empty spot, wishing for your companionship. Those easy going conversations and comfortable silences. Have I had you, only for you to slip away? Are you searching for me right now? 
I've looked for you time and time again always coming up short. Where will we find each other? Online? Will we see each other somewhere and recognize a safe place in one another's eyes? Oh my sweet, dear friend, my lover come to me. Let my words awaken you. I wait for you as patiently as I can possibly bear.

title: Are you on here for the same reason I am?
text:
I don't know about other men, but I would like to explain why I am pursuing an affair with another woman, though married.

Our society tells us that if a man is married and looking for romance elsewhere, that alone is pretty much proof that he is not reliable. A total rotter, right? Wrong!

The one thing I most certainly am, is reliable. My career successes are a direct measure of that. I take things seriously and am conscientious to a fault. The reason I am still married is because I do not shirk responsibilities. My family's security being the most important. However, there is one thing lacking in my life and that is life itself. I want to be in love and full of life and looking for it outside of my marriage is why I am pursuing an affair. If wanting to be happy in life makes me despicable, so be it. This is what I need and it's a high priority in my life. It is that important to me.

I think obligation keeps most marriages together. It sure has mine. Ours is as comfortable as an old shoe. My wife is completely predictable, in routine and conversation. When the kids leave home, I'll be her only interest. That scares me. She is more of a sibling than a partner.

The woman that I get involved with will prove to me beyond a shadow of a doubt that what I will have at home is not love I once had, you know, the rev up your engine and put it in overdrive, the wild, passionate fun kind of love.

The affair must NOT be based on sex. Sex of course will make us feel better. But I need more....do you?

When you look in the mirror, do you wonder, Is this all there is? The answer is NO! Don't lose track of a most important thing, YOU

Is wanting to feel alive and emotionally charged expecting too much? I want that special person, partner, and lover. Someone who loves the man, not the security he provides. One smart, confident, alive,woman, with fire, a mind of her own, depth, character, dreams and who only wants to share life and love with me. Having passionate conversations, doing things together, laughing, that is what I want. To experience everything possible before I die. It can't be too late.

I am sure we will be fascinated by the joy we feel when we are with each other. Learning how we think, discovering what's important to us is such a rich feeling.

What do you think??????

Please reply with a pic or put Same in the subject when you are emailing me and Please be in shape and take care of yourself as I workout everyday and take care of myself.

title: RE Update to realtor
text: OK, that makes it a LITTLE clearer but there is still some info missing. Was the inspector a third party independent inspector? If so, he/she got paid for their inspection regardless whether it passed or failed, either way, the inspector gets paid. The option fee, I'm guessing was to ensure that the seller would not accept any offers until you made a decision, which may have some merit but it is not a requirement, that fee would go to the seller, not the realtor, but it is not a required fee that you HAVE to pay. Depending on the inspector, an inspection should have been done in a day or two, but possibly it may have been longer since the market in DFW is going crazy and maybe those guys are super busy. If you feel that the realtor charged you fees or made you pay for things AND those fees went to the realtor, then you should file a complaint with the Real Estate Commission in Austin. I would take an educated guess and say that the realtor didn't keep any of your money, it went to the inspector and to the seller. Now, if the seller had previous reports showing deficiencies with the home and they didn't disclose them and the realtor knew about the problems, then you may have a case against the seller and the realtor.

title: Update to Realtor Update
text: Let me clear some things up so hopefully the insulting emails and updates will stop. Upon showing interest in the house, I made an offer pending results of insect and property inspection. My realtor told me that I would have to pay for the inspections plus pay for the option period. Being the owner worked for the Dallas County Sheriffs Dept. I figured they would be fair and treat me right. The house failed the property inspection with code and safety violations. The owner would not do ANY repairs. So she got the insect and property inspection for free and kept the option period money. So I'm sitting here out 450 dollars with nothing but my you know what in my hand. Lesson learned. Don't trust anybody even if they are in law enforcement.

title: RE: Bad Drivers

And I've NEVER seen a highway sign that said, "Left Lane For Passing Only UNLESS YOU'RE DOING JUST THE SPEED LIMIT. BARELY". Or, "Slower Traffic Keep Right UNLESS YOU'RE DOING JUST THE SPEED LIMIT. BARELY". Neither one! Not even once!

title: Charlotte Pollis
text:
Please help us find Charlotte. She has been missing for over 20 years.

Height 5'2" Weight 300 pounds

Charlotte Pollis was sick on March 11, 1994, the day before she vanished. That night, the grandparents looked after the couple's two children while her husband took Pollis to the hospital for treatment of an acute ear infection. After returning from the hospital, the grandparents left, and Pollis phoned her mother. It was the last time anyone has heard from her.

At 08:50 the next day, Pollis's mother phoned her. Her husband answered and said that Pollis was still sleeping. The husband says that he last saw Pollis shortly after that phone call. He says he told her to stay in bed and rest, and then he brought the children off for a day of errands.

When the husband returned he found that Pollis was gone, and assumed she was at her mothers, or with another family member. As the night went on, Pollis' family called to see if she returned. Pollis did not contact any family, or friends that day, which is very unusual. A missing report was made at approximately 23.00 on March 12th, 1994. The report was filed by her husband, at the request of the family.

On March 13th, 1994 a search for Pollis was conducted, since she was not heard from, and concerns of her welfare started to grow. A search of the area provided no information, nor did the subsequent canvass of the neighborhood. There were no signs of foul play at the time, but it was not ruled out.

When police came to check the house, investigators found that the house was spotless, having been cleaned from top to bottom. Investigators did find a stain of human blood in the trunk of Pollis' car, but the sample was too small to allow positive identification.

Pollis left without a purse, money, or identification. Also both of Pollis' winter coats were still in the house, along with her jewelry, and shoes. Pollis has never contacted her family, which is very unusual since she would call her mother, or other members multiple times a day. Family members feel that Pollis would never leave her children.

Investigators
If you have any information concerning this case, please contact:

Girard Police Department
Detective John Norman

title: Bad drivers
text:
I've seen lots of posts lately about bad drivers; especially the left-lane lollygaggers. The one thing I've never seen any of them answer about that is WHY. Why drive in the left lane if you're not passing anyone? What is it that is so appealing to you about that lane? Maybe you do have a "right" to drive over there (debatable), even if it IS against the law. Does that mean you SHOULD? I'm guessing that you also have the "right" to shoot yourself in the face enough times to finally hit your brain, but SHOULD you? Okay, let's just leave that question on the table for now.......think about it and get back to us.

Passing on the right WAS against the law when there were only two-lane roads; yes, it was ILLEGAL to pass on the shoulder. Nowadays, with two or more lanes of traffic all going in the same direction, it is perfectly okay to pass someone in any of the other lanes on the right (no, still NOT on the shoulder!). Not only is it okay, it is practically mandatory on today's multi-lane roads. Otherwise, no one would be allowed to drive any faster than the SLOWEST dumbass in the far left lane!

But please; ANY of you (and you know who you are) that drive in the left-hand lane for no apparent reason, PLEASE explain your fascination with that lane. If one or more lanes are open on your right, and people are passing you on the right (and giving you the finger), WHY do you feel the compulsion to stay over there? Do you think it is giving you some "power" that you can't get any other way? Do you think of yourself as a "bad boy" and that breaking THAT law is what makes you a "bad boy"?

Or is it maybe one of the following?
A) Your parents failed you so badly that they didn't teach you any manners whatsoever.
B) Your parents failed you so badly that they didn't teach you to respect traffic laws.
C) Your parents failed you so badly that they didn't educate you well enough to even read road signs.
D) ALL OF THE ABOVE.
E) Your parents didn't actually fail you; they just gave up because they KNEW you were just too stupid to learn.

Your answer doesn't really matter because no one actually cares what you, as a person, thinks; some of us are just a little curious about your reasoning. Whatever your answer may be, at every possible opportunity, I'm still going to cut in front of you and brake-check you. Every opportunity, every time. And, should your reflexes NOT be up to par, all I have to do is tell the trooper that I was trying to not hit that little white dog back there. Plus, as an added bonus, I have EXCELLENT insurance!

Do you think you'll speed up at the last minute and stop me from doing it? Could be possible, I guess, but I highly doubt that your POS 1985 4-cylinder Chevy Cavalier with the headliner hanging into the back seat (you call that a "sun shade"? lol) actually CAN. Or that YOU have the guts to actually try it. Look at my truck. It's a work truck; it's been banged up more times than Manny Pacquiao. Does it LOOK like I care if it gets another dent? It's old and it's ugly, but it runs perfectly AND powerfully. After you try it, I'll get a HUGE laugh at you in my rear-view mirror as you bang your forehead and scream to yourself, "I COULDA HAD A V-8!" Now, THAT'S entertainment! lol

title: Re: Russell Simmons and banks. He wAs correct.
text:
Re:Re: Russell Simmons and Banks. OTHER STATES U R ASSED OUT.

I moved to Texas from Memphis TN. If you have something on Chex Systems you are assed out. In other states that are far more 'rigid' than Texas where the companies have far less competition no one will bank with you. No one at all. As a matter of fact, my friend that lives in a very southern state just opened a bank account with NOTHING on Chex Systems and they required them to put at least a $500.00 deposit. In Texas, the banks will PAY YOU to open an account. Not so in other places. 

So the person is correct. Leave outside of Texas and try to get a bank account with something on Chex Systems. THEY WILL NOT DO IT.

As a matter of fact, I was so shocked with all the 'Second Chance' banks and apartments when I first moved to Texas I called home to report this. I had never seen anything like it. Not even the utility companies. There are utility companies that will open up an account for you even if you have no social, etc. They just charge a deposit. In Memphis, you have to have a social. There is only ONE utility company and you have to drive down and sit and wait with your social security card and ID in hand to let them scan it, check it, run your credit, etc. It's very old fashioned.

So Texas is very different than other states.
